p: The IL 1-butyl-3-methyl-imidazolium chloride, [bmim]Cl, was used as electrolyte in the study of the redox properties of Cu(I) and Cu(II) ions, showing that the Cu(I) ion can be oxidized to Cu(II) and reduced to Cu(0), and that Cu(II) can be reduced to Cu(I) by the metallic Cu(0) [ 33]. These electrochemical processes are depicted in Figure 2.
